be.ac.ulb.infof307.g03.models

Class SelectionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.ac.ulb.infof307.g03.models.SelectionManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class SelectionManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer
    Author:
    fhennecker The SelectionManager makes sure the following constraints for selection are respected: - maximum 1 room is selected - maximum 1 object is selected - a room and an object cannot be selected at the same time - the current floor is the floor on which the last selected room/object was

      Floor currentFloor() 
      void select(Selectionable obj)
      - Sets an object as *the* selected object in the entire scene - Sets its selected flag to true - Saves its changes in the model, notifies observers - Sets the current floor to the floor of obj

    • Method Detail

      • unselectAll

        public void unselectAll()
        Unselect all the selected objects in database

      • select

        public void select(Selectionable obj)
        - Sets an object as *the* selected object in the entire scene - Sets its selected flag to true - Saves its changes in the model, notifies observers - Sets the current floor to the floor of obj
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to select

      • toggleSelect

        public void toggleSelect(Selectionable obj)
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to select if it wasn't selected, or to unselect if it was selected This method writes indirectly to the model and notifies all observers.

      • unselect

        public void unselect(java.lang.Boolean mustNotify)
        - Unselects the currently selected object in the scene - Sets its selected flag to false - Writes the changes to the model, notifies observers
        Parameters:
        mustNotify - do we need to consider the unselection as a change and notify observers? unselect(Boolean)

      • unselect

        public void unselect()
        Uses unselect and notifies all observers.
        See Also:
        unselect(Boolean)

      • selected

        public Selectionable selected()
        Returns:
        the currently selected object in the scene
